title: Can a water pump be used for a garden hose? I use a trash water pump to run my sprinkler off-grid.

tasks.task: Installing a two-inch trash pump from Harbor Freight to a sprinkler system.
subtasks: Acquire necessary components (two-inch female coupler, reducers, PVC pipe).
Connect two-inch hose to two-inch female coupler.
Attach two-inch reducer to female coupler.
Connect inch-and-a-half reducer to two-inch reducer.
Thread three-quarter-inch reducer into inch-and-a-half reducer.
Attach three-quarter-inch PVC pipe (two feet long) to three-quarter-inch reducer.
Connect three-quarter-inch to three-quarter-inch thread to maintain compatibility with garden hose.
Connect garden hose to sprinkler system.
Test system by turning pump on low, then increasing to desired pressure.
Verify system works without pump modifications or additional adjustments.

tasks.task: Watering grass using the connected sprinkler system.
subtasks: Use two-inch trash pump to supply water to the sprinkler system.
Activate sprinkler system to water grass.
Monitor water pressure and adjust pump settings as necessary.

tasks.task: Setting up a garden with a tractor.
subtasks: Prepare a tilled garden bed using a tractor.
Install sprinkler system for garden irrigation.
Water the garden using the connected two-inch trash pump and sprinkler system.
